article.title: Solar and nuclear physics uncertainties in cosmic-ray propagation

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main focus of this scientific article?
choices: Determining the exact origin of cosmic rays in the Milky Way.
Assessing uncertainties in cosmic-ray propagation models stemming from solar and nuclear physics.
Analyzing the chemical composition of cosmic rays using the Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer (AMS).
Developing a new theoretical framework for understanding dark matter annihilation signals.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Table I, what is the value of the injection spectral index for elements heavier than hydrogen (Z > 1)?
What key difference between proton and helium fluxes does Figure 1 (left) highlight?
choices: Helium flux is significantly higher than proton flux across all energies.
Proton and helium fluxes show identical energy dependence.
Proton flux measurements exhibit much larger uncertainties than helium flux measurements.
The reference model accurately reproduces the Voyager-1 data for both protons and helium.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend does Figure 4(c) illustrate about the Boron-to-Carbon (B/C) ratio over time?
choices: A steady increase in the B/C ratio across all energies.
A strong dependence on the solar cycle, with lower ratios during solar minimum.
A nearly constant B/C ratio across the entire observation period.
Significant fluctuations with no clear pattern, suggesting issues with the model.
